comment_text: Since Star-Forming Nebulas are Formed from Interstellar Medium. How did the Interstellar Medium Got Their Heavy Elements like Oxygen, Silicon, Iron and Nickel From?
How Star-Forming Nebulas. Which are Gaseous Dust Clouds in Space That Forms Stars. Got Their Heavy Elements From? Like How Star-Forming Nebula Got Their Heavy Elements like Rocks and Metals From?

And when I mean dead star pair I mean a pair of a neutron star or a white dwarf( or even a black dwarf as the neutron star sucks the life blood from the white dwarf star) and this is one of the most amazing binary pairs ever after neutron star pairs, and they are more common in globular clusters than in any other places,
When they collide one of two ways what will happen, one way is they will create a black hole ,and the other way is they will create a magnetar( a very powerful version of neutron star).
And the explosion from the collision is about between one to four times more energy than our sun will in its entire life time.

It’s more likely that white dwarfs colliding create the elements that are so essential for life ,not neutron stars ,which usually create toxic metals such as lead, and neutron star pairs can be thousands of times more rare than white dwarf pairs, and dead star pairs are more common than neutron star pairs but more rare than white dwarf pairs.
Now that is thinking outside the box. No evidence. He just knew. My admiration for this man knows no bounds.

When two sun like stars die together its more possible that the two white dwarf stars they leave behind to make a slow but ever death spiral.the heavier white dwarf pulls the smaller one inward until finaly they collide into a type 1A supernova.
